intro: Homalolepis, commonly known as the mountain holly or rock holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. They are native to various regions in the Southern Hemisphere, including South America, Africa, and Australia. Homalolepis species often thrive in rocky or well-drained soils, and they are adapted to grow in harsh, mountainous environments. Their botanical features make them valuable for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
